title: (x) HELMUT LANG logo - Helvetica Condensed Bold {Jazzy B}
content:
I thought I would find a post about this one but maybe it is to obvious. Close to Trade Gothic. Anyway, I cant make out what it is so if you have an idea I would certainly be glad to hear it. Have a nice weekend.  
Petter

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131015558im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Helmut_Lang_5070.JPG)
author: P_P

comments.content: The Helmut Lang font is definitely not Helvetica. I'm not sure what it is, and I always loved how the inner angles of the M cuts into the top, It's a very elegant touch. However, it could be a modified Helvetica.

i love the typo. Its so simple, perfect, minimal but still human and warm. And it suits kongenial to the products. Unfortunately he, Helmut, sold his company. He s an artist and not a businessman, Respect to Helmut.

It DOES look like [Helvetica Condensed Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131015558/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/helvetica/cond-bold/) as Jazzy noted. Consider the old cut, not the »Helvetica Neue« rework.
